description: The Lean Six Sigma Greenbelt Certification offers many options when it comes to getting certified. This series covers everything you need to know from beginning to end. Cherokee Boose introduces Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern to explain the process and project ideology in detail.
name: Lean Six Sigma - Green Belt
subtitle: Green Belt

episodes.description: The Lean Six Sigma Greenbelt Certification offers many options when it comes to getting certified. This series covers everything you need to know from beginning to end. Cherokee Boose introduces Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern to explain the process and project ideology in detail.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.046 --> 00:00:05.279
[SOUND]
>> Welcome to your Lean Six Sigma,

2
00:00:05.279 --> 00:00:08.994
Green Belt Certification Preparation
series overview.

3
00:00:08.994 --> 00:00:10.467
I'm your show host.

4
00:00:10.467 --> 00:00:14.525
And we're briefly going to be describing
what this series is all about and

5
00:00:14.525 --> 00:00:17.440
what we'll be covering
throughout the series.

6
00:00:17.440 --> 00:00:20.806
With us to help me explain that,
is Dr Terra Vanzant-Stern.

7
00:00:20.806 --> 00:00:24.410
Thank you for joining us today doctor
>> Thank you for having me Cherokee.

8
00:00:24.410 --> 00:00:25.090
>> You're welcome.

9
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:29.035
So, when I decide I wanna sit for
the Green Belt Certification,

10
00:00:29.035 --> 00:00:30.139
where do I begin?

11
00:00:30.139 --> 00:00:32.910
What are we gonna be
covering within this series?

12
00:00:32.910 --> 00:00:36.330
>> Okay, I think I would like to
begin by saying that my company,

13
00:00:36.330 --> 00:00:41.370
SSD Global Solutions, takes a leaner
approach to teaching Lean Six Sigma.

14
00:00:41.370 --> 00:00:43.910
In fact, we call it Leaner Six Sigma.

15
00:00:43.910 --> 00:00:49.900
So when you get done, you can still sit
for the Lean Six Sigma Green Belt exam.

16
00:00:49.900 --> 00:00:53.243
But we just teach the concepts in
a little bit easier way to understand.

17
00:00:53.243 --> 00:00:55.891
To prepare you for the test, and-
>> Well, I'm all for that.

18
00:00:55.891 --> 00:00:58.289
>> [LAUGH] And
the first thing we're gonna do,

19
00:00:58.289 --> 00:01:01.291
is we're just gonna talk
about what you need to know.

20
00:01:01.291 --> 00:01:05.406
And there's a little bit of confusion
because you can be Six Sigma certified or

21
00:01:05.406 --> 00:01:08.350
just Lean certified or
Lean Six Sigma certified.

22
00:01:08.350 --> 00:01:09.800
So we're gonna talk
a little bit about that.

23
00:01:09.800 --> 00:01:10.884
>> And you'll break it down for us.

24
00:01:10.884 --> 00:01:11.507
>> Exactly.

25
00:01:11.507 --> 00:01:13.750
>> Okay, great.
>> The different paths that you can go on.

26
00:01:13.750 --> 00:01:16.990
I shouldn't say little, cuz they all
require some studying, obviously.

27
00:01:16.990 --> 00:01:18.435
And then what we're gonna do,

28
00:01:18.435 --> 00:01:21.337
is we're going to use a method
called accelerated learning.

29
00:01:21.337 --> 00:01:24.470
And what that means is we're gonna
kind of take a top-down approach.

30
00:01:24.470 --> 00:01:28.377
So we're gonna give you sort of the idea
of what are the process improvement

31
00:01:28.377 --> 00:01:28.879
basics?

32
00:01:28.879 --> 00:01:32.695
What are the math and statistics basis?

33
00:01:32.695 --> 00:01:35.810
What are the actual models and
methodologies?

34
00:01:35.810 --> 00:01:40.050
Because we believe at SSD Global
Solutions, that a lot of times if we

35
00:01:40.050 --> 00:01:43.630
provide a framework,
you can fill in some of the blanks.

36
00:01:43.630 --> 00:01:46.810
Many of the things that you'll be learning
in this program, you've done before.

37
00:01:46.810 --> 00:01:48.730
You just call them different things.

38
00:01:48.730 --> 00:01:52.160
So some of the other topics is we're
gonna talk about critical to quality.

39
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:55.120
We're gonna really concentrate
on the DMAIC model,

40
00:01:55.120 --> 00:01:58.700
the different phases of
this problem solving model.

41
00:01:58.700 --> 00:02:01.310
We're also gonna address
other problem solving models,

42
00:02:01.310 --> 00:02:04.670
such as typical problem solving and
scientific problem solving.

43
00:02:04.670 --> 00:02:08.650
And plan, do, check, act, which is
something you may have already studied

44
00:02:08.650 --> 00:02:10.790
in your project management program.

45
00:02:10.790 --> 00:02:11.830
>> Well that sounds amazing.

46
00:02:11.830 --> 00:02:16.220
I can't wait to get started, and I hope
you guys are excited just as much as I am.

47
00:02:16.220 --> 00:02:19.210
And I just wanna really say thank
you Dr Stern for being with us.

48
00:02:19.210 --> 00:02:21.720
And well, let's go ahead and get started.

49
00:02:21.720 --> 00:02:25.930
So we'll wrap up this particular intro and
sign off as your show host.

50
00:02:25.930 --> 00:02:27.240
I'm Cherokee Boose.

51
00:02:27.240 --> 00:02:29.887
I'm Dr Terra Vanzant-Stern
with SSD Global,

52
00:02:29.887 --> 00:02:32.011
hoping that you're going to go lean.

53
00:02:32.011 --> 00:02:34.851
>> We'll see you next
time here at ITProTV.

54
00:02:34.851 --> 00:02:38.449
[SOUND]

episodes.description: This episode introduces you to Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern from SSD Global Solutions and host Cherokee Boose. You will also learn of the different certifications available as well as sources for study resources.
episodes.title: Introduction

episodes.description: In this episode you will learn the core concepts of process improvement as well as identifying other process improvement programs.  In addition to distinguishing between real vs projected return on investment, you will also discover Lean Six Sigma ROI and why ROI is so important to the Process Improvement Effort.
episodes.title: Process Improvement Basics

episodes.description: In this episode you will continue to learn about project charters and project planning. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee discuss the key differences of a project charter versus a process improvement charter. You will also learn how to generate a LSS project report.  Lastly, you will be presented with examples of an extremely popular project planning tool Work Breakdown Structure (WBS ) .
episodes.title: Process Improvement Basics Part 2

episodes.description: This episode covers several types of metrics that can be used to measure performance. Specifically, Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee converse over metrics such as, Sigma, COPQ, DPU, DPMO, Cp/Cpk, Cycle Time and Mean/Mode/Median just to name a few!
episodes.title: LSS Metric Basics

episodes.description: This episode defines and compares key terminology. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee first speak on the distinctions between methodologies versus tools as well as Waterfall versus Circular Thinking. You also discover proper brainstorming techniques using tools such as the Affinity diagram. Other topics covered are six core principles and popular concepts in Lean Six Sigma.
episodes.title: Core Concepts and Terms

episodes.description: This show focuses on five important methodologies.  Particularly you will see the TYPICAL or STANDARD, DMAIC, PDCA, DFSS and KAIZEN models broken down. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern emphasizes the significance of the DMAIC model, in which will be covered in depth in future shows within this series.
episodes.title: Models Methodologies

episodes.description: In this episode Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose begin to speak about seven different tools of quality. First,  you will see the Fishbone Diagram, also called a Cause and Effect Diagram or Ishikawa Diagram. Second, you will examine several different styles of flowcharts how to effectively use them.
episodes.title: Seven Tools of Quality

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation of the seven tools of quality. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose examine ways to use tools such as check sheets as to do lists, tollgates, as a list before an activity starts or even as a way a way to gather information for charts like histograms or Pareto Charts.
episodes.title: Seven Tools of Quality Part 2

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation of the seven tools of quality. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose identify practical applications for Scatter Diagrams to help identify correlations or the absence of a correlation. They also examine line charts, run charts, and control charts.
episodes.title: Seven Tools of Quality Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode you will examine the 8 Areas of waste including defects such as overproduction, waiting, non-utilized staff talent, transportation, inventory, motion, and extra processing. You also learn of tools such as TIM WOODS to help identify waste.
episodes.title: Waste, Voices and CTQs

episodes.description: Being able to shift your thinking and see thru the lens of others or even inanimate objects may offer insight you otherwise may never of considered. In this episode you learn how to gain perspective from the voice of the customer (VOC), voice of the employee (VOE), voice of the process (VOP), and the voice of the business (VOB). You also learn how to identify critical to quality (CTQ) components.
episodes.title: Waste, Voices and CTQs Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode you understand how being cognizant and thinking of your suppliers, inputs, processes, outputs and customers can make you a stronger Project Manager. SIPOC is another example of the many flexible tools you learn in this series. We can use SIPOC to do things like perform stakeholders’ Analysis to comparisons.
episodes.title: Suppliers Inputs Process Outputs Customers

episodes.description: It’s no secret graphs and charts are great visual aids that can really make a presentation pop! This episode covers several different ways to convey your data and ideas.
episodes.title: Important Graphs and Charts

episodes.description: The DMAIC model is a very popular mythology that should be fully understood. In this episode Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose introduce the Define phase. The key aspects of the design phase are to make sure you are working on the right problem and to make sure the people involved understand what you are working on.
episodes.title: DMAIC Model - Define Phase

episodes.description: In this episode Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose spend extra time discussing the define phase to make sure you deeply understand this phase. In addition to using tools you have learned in previous shows you will also learn new tools such as House of Quality, QFD, and Kano Analysis.
episodes.title: DMAIC Model - Define Phase Part 2

episodes.description: The second phase of the DMAIC model  is Measure. In this show you will see how Measure ties into the model. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose explain why it is so important to obtain an “as is” picture of the current process. You also look at what to measure, how to measure, and how to articulate the measurement with tools such as Fishbone, Balanced Scorecard, benchmarking and observation.
episodes.title: DMAIC Model - Measure Phase

episodes.description: The third phase of the DMAIC model is Analyze. In this show you will see how Analyze ties into the model. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose explain how tools from previous shows tie into this phase. You will also see additional tools such as the 6 hats, critical thinking wheel, critical thinking levels, critical thinking chart and 6 critical questions.
episodes.title: DMAIC Model - Analyze Phase

episodes.description: The fourth phase of the DMAIC model is Improve. In this show you will see how Improve ties into the model. Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose describe the steps one should take in this phase such as listing three to five Solutions from analyze, gaining Consensus on which one to try, trying it out first (Pilot, Focus Group, Simulation), creating your Project Plan and rolling it out.
episodes.title: DMAIC Model - Improve Phase

episodes.description: In this show Dr. Terra Vanzant Stern and Cherokee Boose designate three important tasks and how to implement them. One should convey what they did and why people should care, what you saved, made or avoiding spending in dollars, as well as providing history if necessary.
episodes.title: DMAIC Model - Control Phase

episodes.description: This episode reviews all the phases and how they work together and depend on each other. You also see a review of tolls available at each phase.
episodes.title: DMAIC Model - Review
